skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

attributes.bullet_text:
Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
Allows the unit to attack and destroy walls in melee. This attribute also adds a  +50% damage multiplier against buildings.
When attacking braced charge defenders, this unit only loses half of its charge bonus

skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
You cannot build an empire without sacrificing a few sons…
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Some Liche Priests believe the King's single-minded madness is because Djaf, the God of War and Death, has personally selected King Imrathepis to defend the lands of Nehekhara from the Greenskin horde. These priests have imbued the King's armies with powerful magics to further what they perceive as a divine crusade. Prince Rakaph III tolerates this as there seems little else to do. At the very least if his mad father can be "aimed", he can be put to some kind of use for the Prince.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense and passionate feelings of the King start to flow into his army.

skillTree.localised_name: Madness of the Crimson King: Growing
skillTree.localised_description: Growing Fury. The power of the Realm of Souls flowing through the Mad King and while it empowers his troops to new heights, the fury within them also grows.

skillTree.localised_name: Madness of the Crimson King: Overwhelming
skillTree.localised_description: Overwhelming Urge. The Mad King becomes a gateway to the Realm of Souls, with pure viciousness flowing through him to his army.

skillTree.localised_description: Unquenchable Battlelust. Imrathepis drags his entire army into his madness, while their battlelust and fury is taken to an entirely new level, they completely lose control and are swept into the Kings madness.

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.

skillTree.localised_description: It takes an iron will and unnatural - supernatural - strength to rally bound troops routed by magical means.
Arrows loosed under the ever-watchful eye of the Serpent Goddess find their marks with divine precision.

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.

skillTree.localised_description: It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

items.colour_text: This thin and otherwise plain bone brooch, carefully and expertly scrimshawed from the head of the tyrant ogre leader Folgut the Corpulent, was presented to King Imrathepis by his son as a gift. Unknowingly it simply serves as a focus for his father's rage, and as a constant reminder of his failure.

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

items.colour_text: Crafted by the dark Liche Priests of Djaf, into this Warblade they have poured from the Realm of Souls pure undiluted hate and malice against the the Greenskins. The wielder of this blade will never tire from killing and every downed Greenskin is a sacrifice to Djaf.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Greenskins

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

Leadership: +8 when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)
Melee attack: +8 when fighting against Greenskins

items.colour_text: Prince Rakaph III commissioned his favoured Necrotect to craft a deathmask for his father like his own after the Mortuary Cult could only partly reconstitute King Imrathepis after his destruction and digestion. Even their mighty magics could not return any semblance of a face to his immortal body, and his leg still will eternally be crooked after being used as an ogre toothpick.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

items.colour_text: In his mortal lifetime, King Imrathepis fought beside Alcadizaar the Conqueror, and he was one of the great ruler's chief lieutenants. The Crimson King was present during many pivotal battles, including the subjugation of Ka-Sabar, the pacification of the Black Boar Orc tribes and the sacking of cursed Lahmia, where Imrathepis bested several Vampires in personal combat. This heavily enchanted Golden Corselet was presented to Imrathepis by Alcadizaar as a gift to cement their friendship. It is said to contain a spark of Ptra's flames which the Mortuary Cult called down to burn Lahmia to the ground.

backgroundSkills.localised_name: The Madness of the Crimson King
backgroundSkills.localised_description: Prince Rakaph III has decreed to the Mortuary Cult that only in the most dire of circumstances should his father be awoken. For Imrathepis is mad beyond reason with an untamable battlelust, forever consumed with the last thoughts of his mortal lifes last battle. So great is this madness that it infects his troops and those around him. Upon awakening from his sacred sarcophagus, the Crimson King seems unaware of any passage of time, or even his current immortal state, and is consumed by a lust for battle. He immediately sets about reclaiming the lands he had conquered in centuries past, not realising that he has done the same thing again and again every time he arises. Time and again King Imrathepis and his legions sweep north through the Badlands like a hurricane of blood, his thirst for battle unquenchable. From atop the armoured platform of his Khemrian Warsphinx, the Crimson King slaughters scores of greenskin savages. King Imrathepis leads every charge from the front, driving his blade deep into the flesh of his enemies as his Khemrian Warsphinx, dripping with blood, wades through the hordes of Orcs and pulped their bodies underfoot. Such is the way of greenskins that they are often overjoyed at his arrival though, and warbands will seek him out to challenge him. Dare you awaken this mad king?

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: In his mortal lifetime, King Imrathepis fought beside Alcadizaar the Conqueror, and he was one of the great ruler's chief lieutenants. The Crimson King was present during many pivotal battles, including the subjugation of Ka-Sabar, the pacification of the Black Boar Orc tribes and the sacking of cursed Lahmia, where Imrathepis bested several Vampires in personal combat. This heavily enchanted Golden Corselet was presented to Imrathepis by Alcadizaar as a gift to cement their friendship. It is said to contain a spark of Ptra's flames which the Mortuary Cult called down to burn Lahmia to the ground.

Crafted by the dark Liche Priests of Djaf, God of War and Death, into this Warblade they have poured from the Realm of Souls pure undiluted hate and malice against the the Greenskins. The wielder of this blade will never tire from killing and every downed Greenskin is a sacrifice to Djaf.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Greenskins

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Prince Rakaph III commissioned his favoured Necrotect to craft a deathmask for his father like his own after the Mortuary Cult could only partly reconstitute King Imrathepis after his destruction and digestion. Even their mighty magics could not return any semblance of a face to his immortal body, and his leg still will eternally be crooked after being used as an ogre toothpick.
